x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.problem_statement: Young people often participate in civic activities - clean-up drives, awareness campaigns, voter education, and local volunteering but lack a structured way to track, showcase, or build on their contributions. NGOs and schools struggle to measure engagement, issue credentials, or connect youth to leadership opportunities. Sponsors want to support youth-led change but lack visibility into real impact. This leads to under-recognition, missed mentorship, and low continuity in civic engagement.
x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.project_name: CivicSpark - Youth Action Tracker & Leadership Portfolio
x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.solution_proposal:
How do you envision the ideal solution to this  problem?

 

Which ServiceNow products or capabilities would be used?

  • Youth can log civic actions (e.g., volunteering, organizing, speaking) and build verified profiles
  • NGOs and educators can assign challenges, host events, and issue QR-linked badges
  • Dashboards show impact metrics, regional trends, and sponsor visibility
  • Sponsors can fund youth leadership drives and track engagement
  • Optional: Mentorship matching and fellowship applications
  • Optional: Storytelling wall to showcase youth-led change

 

Capabilities:

  • App Engine Studio for action logs, contributor profiles, and event records
  • Flow Designer for badge generation, mentorship routing, and sponsor updates
  • UI Builder for dashboards and mobile-friendly views
  • IntegrationHub for syncing with school portals, email/SMS platforms, or civic APIs
  • Attachment API for uploading photos, certificates, and campaign assets
  • QR Code Generation & Base64 Encoding for badge access and challenge invites
  • Scoped App with ACLs for privacy, role-based access, and educator permissions

 

Are there any technical dependencies for the proposed solution?

  • QR code generation for badges and challenge invites
  • Optional: SMS gateway for reminders and updates
  • Optional: Civic APIs or fellowship portals for sync
  • Optional: Gamification engine for leaderboards and milestone

 

What challenges would you foresee in implementing this idea?

  • Ensuring authenticity and verification of youth contributions
  • Designing a simple, mobile-first UX for students and mentors
  • Encouraging consistent engagement across regions
  • Balancing gamification with meaningful civic impact
  • Building trust and visibility for sponsors and educators
